verses.verse: {The Loved One} d Night after night on my bed, I sought the one I love; I sought him, but didn't find him.
I'll get up and go all around the city, throughout the streets, and in the squares. I'll seek the one I love. I sought him, but didn't find him.
The watchmen who go all around the city found me. I asked, {The Heb. lacks I asked} "Have you seen the one I love?"
I had just passed them when I found the one I love. I held him and wouldn't let him go until I brought him to my mother's house, to the room of the one who conceived me.
Swear to me, young women of Jerusalem, by the gazelles or by the does of the field, that you won't awaken or arouse love before its proper time! {Lit. until it pleases}

{The Lover Arrives} d What {Or Who} is this coming up from the desert like columns of smoke, perfumed with myrrh {Myrrh was a fragrant spice used as a perfume.} and incense {Or frankincense} from all the fragrant powders of the merchant?

Look! It's Solomon's sedan chair, {Or palanquin ; i. e. a portable compartment for carrying important people.} with 60 of the best soldiers in Israel {Lit. mighty men from the mighty men of Israel} surrounding it.
All of them are wearing swords and are experienced in battle. Each has his sword on his thigh, ready for the terror of the night. {Lit. thigh, from the terror of the night}
King Solomon made the sedan chair for himself from the trees of Lebanon.
He made its posts of silver, its back of gold. Its seat was purple, and its interior was lovingly inlaid by the young women of Jerusalem.
Come out, young women of Zion, and see King Solomon with the crown with which his mother crowned him on his wedding day his day of great delight. {Lit. day of the rejoicing of his heart}
